intro: Calochortus benthamii var. wallacei, commonly known as the Wallace's mariposa lily, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the genus Calochortus, which includes a variety of flowering plants commonly referred to as mariposa lilies. This particular variety is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. The plant is adapted to arid conditions and is often found in regions with well-drained soils.
